sn11.8:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha had retreated to solitude for the day’s meditation.
sn11.8:4.3: Then Sakka, Lord of Gods, and Verocana, Lord of Demons, approached the Buddha
sn11.8:4.4: and stationed themselves one by each door-post.
sn11.8:4.5: Then Verocana recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn11.8:5.3: When goals are accomplished they shine:
sn11.8:5.4: this is the word of Verocana!”
sn11.8:6.3: Of goals that shine when accomplished,
sn11.8:6.4: none better than patience is found.”
sn11.8:7.2: as befits them in each case.
sn11.8:7.4: of pleasures for all living creatures.
sn11.8:7.5: When goals are accomplished they shine:
sn11.8:7.6: this is the word of Verocana!”
sn11.8:8.2: as befits them in each case.
sn11.8:8.4: of pleasures for all living creatures.
sn11.8:8.5: Of goals that shine when accomplished,
sn11.8:8.6: none better than patience is found.”
